name: name
label: Project name
description: Name used to refer to the carbon project being developed

name: displayImage
label: Display image

name: projectSummary
label: General project description

name: projectMission
label: Brief project summary

name: projectActivities
label: Description of activities

name: domain
label: Project website
description: Link to the project website

name: links
label: Media links
description: Collection of relevant media links (e.g. articles, blog posts)

name: projectMedia
label: Project photos or videos

name: projectProponentName
label: Project proponent name

name: projectStartYear
label: Project start year

name: projectEndYear
label: Project end year

name: termLength
label: Project term commitment (in years)
description: Projects must commit to a minimum project term of 40 years

name: creditStart
label: Crediting start year
description: The start of the crediting period, in which verified GHG emission reductions or removals from to a project activity can result in the issuance of carbon credits (i.e., the year that the project begins issuing credits)

name: creditEnd
label: Crediting end year
description: The end of the crediting period, in which verified GHG emission reductions or removals from to a project activity can result in the issuance of carbon credits (i.e., the year that the project stops issuing credits)

name: projectTimeline
label: Additional details on project timeline
description: Additional details might include an implementation schedule, indicating key dates and milestones in the project's development as well as justification for that schedule

name: projectScale
label: Project scale
description: An indication of the estimated tonnes of CO2e to be sequestered or avoided over the life of the project

name: additionalCertificationUpload
label: Additional certification supporting documents

name: primaryGhg
label: Primary GHG mitigated

name: classificationCategory
label: Classification category
description: Ecological benefit category for the project

name: classificationMethod
label: Classification method
description: Category of the mitigation activity
options: Natural - The activity claim uses natural methods (e.g. IFM)
Technological - The activity claim uses technology (e.g. DAC)
Both: Natural and Technological - The activity claim uses both natural and technology methods (e.g. BECCS)

name: projectType
label: Project type
description: Emission reduction or sequestration pathway of project (eg. IFM, REDD++, Biochar, DAC etc.)
options: Avoided Conversion of Grasslands and Shrublands (ACoGS)
Bioenergy with Carbon Capture and Storage (BECCS)
Methane Gas Leak Detection and Repair
Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation (REDD)

name: projectOther
label: Other project type

name: methodology
label: Methodology
description: Methodology or protocol used for credit generation
options: VM0045 Methodology for Improved Forest Management v1.0
VM0045 Methodology for Improved Forest Management v1.1
ACR Improved Forest Management (IFM) on Non-Federal U.S. Forestlands v2.0
Puro Standard Biochar Methodology Edition 2022 v3

name: projectStatus
label: Project status
description: Indicates the current stage of the project's development: (A) Under development: the project is in the early stages and has not yet completed validation; (B) Validated: The project has been reviewed and approved against the relevant methodology and standards but is not yet generating verified credits; (C) Verified: The project has undergone verification and is actively generating verified credits.

name: enhancementSelect
label: Additional certifications

name: creditIssuer
label: Credit issuer
description: The body responsible for issuing the credits

name: creditIssuerOther
label: Other credit issuer

name: standardVersion
label: Registry standard version used
description: Carbon crediting programs (e.g., Verra, ACR, CAR, Puro Earth) publish general rules and documentation that projects must adhere to in addition to a given methodology. These programs or standards are updated periodically (e.g., ACR Standard Version 8.0, Puro General Rules Version 4.0, etc.)

name: projectRegistryLink
label: Project registry link
description: If relevant, the link to the project's registry listing page

name: projectRegistryID
label: Project registry ID
description: If relevant, the project's unique ID in the project's respective registry

name: approachComments
label: Additional comments on project approach
description: If relevant, any additional or missing information about the project's fundamental approach

name: pdd
label: Project plan document
description: If relevant, the project plan document (e.g., GHG plan, PDD)

name: countries
label: Country or countries of project activity
description: Country or countries where the project activities take place

name: conflictAreas
label: Project takes place in conflict-affected or disputed areas
description: Conflict-affected areas as defined by the World Bank here: https://thedocs.worldbank.org/en/doc/b3c737c4687db176ec98f5c434d0de91-0090082024/original/FCSListFY25.pdf

name: conflictMoreInfo
label: Additional information about the conflict-affected area(s)
description: Additional context on the conflict-affected area(s) and the additional measures taken to implement the project

name: geographicLocation
label: Project boundary file
description: Project boundary files for project locations indicated

name: locationComments
label: Location details
description: Additional comments and context on project location including relevant coordinates where project activities take place

name: organizationClassification
label: Organization classification

name: organizationClassificationOther
label: Organization classification

name: ownershipStructure
label: Ownership structure
description: Major shareholders and/or owners of the organization

name: governanceStructure
label: Governance structure
description: How the organization is governed; all stakeholders involved and systems that guide the organization's decision-making and operations

name: organizationStructureUpload
label: Ownership and governance structure documentation

name: organizationHeadquarters
label: Headquarters city and state
description: Where the main office of the organization is located

name: organizationHeadquartersCountry
label: Headquarters country

name: organizationIncorporation
label: Incorporation city and state
description: Where the organization is incorporated

name: organizationIncorporationCountry
label: Incorporation country

name: projectEmployees
label: Number of employees staffed on project
description: Full-time and part-time employees and contractors who directly work on the project

name: orgMission
label: Organization mission

name: organizationFoundingYear
label: Organization founding year

name: organizationExperiencePathway
label: Number of projects within pathway
description: The number of projects developed by the organization within the specific pathway

name: organizationExperienceProjects
label: Number of total projects developed
description: The total number of projects developed by the organization

name: totalProjectsIssued
label: Number of projects with issued credits

name: organizationExperienceDetails
label: Organization history and experience details

name: organizationOperationYears
label: Years developing carbon projects
description: The number of years the organization has been actively operating projects within this specific pathway or mitigation activity

name: laborChildren
label: Project will not employ persons under the age of 15

name: laborChildDevelopment
label: Project complies with age-related legal frameworks
description: Indicates compliance with the ILO Convention 138 Minimum Age Convention 1973 and/or national labor laws related to minimum age

name: laborWorkersRights
label: Project intends to protect and uphold the rights of workers
description: The rights of workers as defined by the ILO Declaration of Fundamental Principles and Rights at Work

name: laborUpload
label: International standards-compliant code of conduct or other labor rights documentation

name: laborComments
label: Additional comments on labor rights and protection of workers

name: legalComplianceTable
label: Legal compliance

columns.name: legalComplianceTableVerification
columns.label: Compliance verification
columns.description: The entity responsible for verifying compliance with the given law or regulation. N/A if not applicable.

name: nationalLawsCompliance
label: Compliance with all applicable national laws
description: Attestation of compliance with the applicable national laws of the project country

name: nationalLawsMethod
label: Method of compliance proof

name: communityFrameworks
label: Measures taken to comply with frameworks governing the rights of Indigenous, tribal, and local communities
description: If relevant, description of the measures taken to adhere to national or international frameworks supporting the rights of Indigenous, tribal and local communities (including the UN Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples)

name: culturalSite
label: The project site includes or borders archaeological sites or districts listed in national or international registries of historical or cultural significance
description: Disclosure of proximity to dedicated areas of archaeological or cultural significance which are recognized by municipalities, counties, state, national and/or international registries

name: culturalSiteDesignation
label: Purpose of the site's designation
description: Indication of the type of historical, cultural, or archeological distinction granted to the site

name: archaeologicalActivity
label: Project site contains, or is contiguous with, an area designated as sensitive for archaeological activity
description: Areas designated can be at the local, regional, state, national, or international level

name: culturalSiteRegistry
label: Registry recognizing the site
description: Examples include UNESCO World Heritage registry and/or national equivalents

name: parisNdcApplicability
label: The project is counted towards the country's Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs)
options: Yes, counted towards the country's NDC where project occurs
Yes, counted towards the funding country's NDC
No, not counted towards a national-level NDC

name: parisCompliance
label: The country where this project occurs is a party to the Paris Agreement

name: parisLetter
label: Evidence of project's inclusion in the Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) and/or Paris Agreement
description: Link to the letter of approval for the corresponding adjustment if needed

name: carbonRightsDetails
label: Carbon rights overview
description: Overview of the project's right to claim the carbon credits generated by the project activity

name: carbonAuthorization
label: Project is authorized for carbon use
description: Authorization of carbon use indicates that the project activity is legally allowed to be executed
options: Yes, I have a government concession
Yes, I have authorization from the owner (private)
Yes, I have full rights over the carbon

name: carbonCreditOwnership
label: Carbon credit ownership documentation
description: Documentation or supporting evidence of carbon credit rights/ownership

name: carbonConservationContract
label: Concession contract is at least the same length as the crediting period
description: Relevant for public land projects

name: carbonUpload
label: Land or facility ownership documentation

name: carbonIssuing
label: Project is receiving or seeking credit for reductions and removals under another GHG program

name: carbonIssuingYes
label: Evidence of no double issuance

name: carbonRegistration
label: Project has registered under other GHG programs

name: carbonRegistrationYes
label: Registration number and date of project inactivity under other GHG program

name: carbonRejection
label: Project has been rejected by another GHG program

name: carbonRejectionYes
label: Program name(s), reason(s) and date of rejection

name: organizationNameAndRole
label: Organization name and role
description: Entities could include (but are not limited to) GIS advisory; feasibility study; technical document service; administrative service; biodiversity advisory, political advocacy; project consultants; financial institutions

name: economicDisplacementExplain
label: Expected economic displacement effects
description: Possible risks or impacts to the project community that would create obstacles to the ability to find, retain, or secure economic opportunity in the project area

name: physicalDisplacementExplain
label: Expected physical displacement effects
description: Relocation, loss of residential land, or loss of shelter as a result of involuntary acquisition of land and/or involuntary restrictions on land use or on access

name: economicDisplacementPlan
label: Mitigation plan in place to address economic displacement effects
description: Project plan to mitigate possible obstacles to economic opportunity for the project community due to project activities

name: physicalMitigation
label: Mitigation plan in place to address physical displacement effects
description: Project plan to mitigate possible relocation, loss of residential land, or loss of shelter due to project activities

name: physicalMitigationDetails
label: Details of mitigation plan to address physical displacement
description: Mitigation may include, but is not limited to, avoidance, minimization, mitigation, and/or compensation activities

name: economicDisplacementPlanEvidence
label: Documentation of mitigation plan for economic displacement
description: Supporting evidence of the economic displacement mitigation plan

name: economicDisplacementDetails
label: Overview of activities included in the mitigation plan
description: Mitigation may include, but is not limited to, avoidance, minimization, mitigation, and/or compensation activities

name: physicalDisplacementSupportingEvidence
label: Documentation of mitigation plan for physical displacement
description: Supporting evidence of the physical displacement mitigation plan

name: communityDescription
label: Communities and other stakeholders impacted or potentially impacted by the project
description: The communities and other stakeholders impacted (or potentially impacted) by project activities

name: stakeholderIdentificationProcess
label: Stakeholder identification process
description: Overview of the method utilized to identify stakeholders that may be affected by project activities

name: communityImpactDetails
label: Details on expected impacts to communities and stakeholders
description: Overview of the potential impacts the project could incur on the various identified stakeholders

name: expectedImpactsDocument
label: Expected stakeholder impacts supporting documents
description: Documentation, evidence, or recommendation records which substantiate expected stakeholder impacts

name: stakeholderConsultationActual
label: Project has developed a stakeholder consultation plan
description: This plan describes how the project will engage, inform, and gather feedback from people or groups affected by or interested in its success

name: communityConsultationNegativeDetails
label: Justification for the absence of a stakeholder consultation plan

name: consultationDetails
label: Overview of stakeholder consultation plan
description: This can include frequency of meetings, format types (e.g. 1-1 interview, roundtable discussions, focus groups), and how these discussions will be recorded and addressed

name: consultationDocuments
label: Stakeholder consultation plan supporting documents
description: Documents could include a community consultation process overview, consultation timeline, registry-specific documents or questionnaires, etc.

name: healthImpactDisclosure
label: Expected health impact disclosure
description: Outcome of expected community health impacts due to project activities (e.g., changes in potable water quality, pollutant impact, hazardous wastes)

name: healthImpactCommunication
label: Potential health impacts disclosure will be communicated during consultations
description: In the case a project has expected health impacts to the community, these risks will be communicated to stakeholders during the consultation and engagement process

name: socialGroupRiskPlanUpload
label: Risk mitigation plan for identified social groups documentation
description: Documents showcasing risk mitigation plans

name: socialGroup
label: Groups expected to be the focus of outreach and consultations
description: The specific groups that carry a particular emphasis in the consultation or engagement plans

name: socialGroupConsult
label: Project plans to consult and engage with specific vulnerable social groups
description: Indicates whether the project is expected to consult specific groups, such as women, people with disabilities, and/or other minority groups (among others) who may be disproportionately affected by the project compared to other groups

name: socialGroupConsultDetails
label: Overview of consultation/engagement plans with identified social groups
description: Engagement plans or processes with the identified specific vulnerable communities (e.g., women-only consultations or focus groups)

name: socialGroupRiskDetails
label: Potential risks to the identified social groups
description: Description of any possible risks and/or negative impacts the project may have on the identified social groups

name: socialGroupPositiveImpacts
label: Expected positive impacts of the project activity on the identified social groups
description: Expected benefits for the identified social groups (e.g., increased leisure time for a targeted demographic due to the project's implementation)

name: genderActionPlanResources
label: Resources and tools used for gender action plan development
description: Identification of frameworks, resources, or other tools used to inform the project's gender action plan

name: genderActionPlan
label: Gender action plan
description: Action plan identifying gender inequalities and detailing how the project will address them

name: womenEmpowerment
label: Project monitors gender equality/empowerment impacts

name: socialGroupMonitoringPlan
label: Description of gender action plan and resources utilized
description: Overview of the project's approach to monitoring and/or addressing gendered impacts (e.g., safeguarding against negative impacts or enabling positive impacts)

name: exploitation
label: Project addresses harrassment or exploitation of women within the household or other project areas
description: Indication of whether the project addresses exploitation, harassment of women and/or minority groups in the community

name: socialGroupGenderConsultations
label: Project plans to conduct gender sensitive consultations
description: Examples include data collection methods comprised of women-only respondents

name: womenRights
label: Women are formally and fairly entitled to project-related resources
description: For example, if women are formally and fairly entitled to project-related land, water, or other types of resources

name: womenRightsDescription
label: Overview of gendered resource entitlement
description: Description of how women are formally and fairly entitled to project related land water and or other types of resources

name: communityExists
label: Project activities take place in close proximity to tribal or Indigenous lands or otherwise affect Indigenous peoples
description: Project activities either take place in, border, or affect resources that impact nearby recognized or known indigenous territories

name: communityConsultation
label: Indigenous people and/or local communities, including minority groups within, have been informed and agreed to project activities
description: Following principles of Free, Prior, and Informed Consent as indicated in international humanitarian law, such as the UN Declaration on the Rights to Indigenous People

name: landRightsRec
label: Project contains explicit contracts with Indigenous, tribal, and local communities before the project begins
description: In line with Free, Prior, and Informed Consent principles, the project and the indigenous, tribal, and/or local community have agreed on clear contractual terms governing project activities and operations

name: carbonContractLength
label: Length of project contract with Indigenous, tribal, and local communities
description: Indication of contract length or agreed upon time before reassessment of contract terms with relevant indigenous, tribal, or local communities

name: contractPublic
label: Publicly available information on the contracts with communities or governments
description: Openly available documentation of contracts

name: contractPenalty
label: Penalty clauses on the contracts for Indigenous, tribal, and local communities
description: Description of any contract clauses that hold the counterparty responsible for compensation (e.g., financial payments, infrastructure repairs) in case of breach

name: specialMeasureDetails
label: Data integration into free, prior, and informed consent
description: Details on how data was integrated into free, prior, and informed consent

name: grievance
label: Project will establish a grievance mechanism to enable stakeholders to report and address concerns
description: Indicates whether the project will set up a formal process or channel (e.g., email, written submissions, listening sessions) for individuals, groups, or communities to raise complaints or concerns about project impacts, with structured procedures for recording grievances and responses

name: grievanceReport
label: Grievances and other reported issues are made public
description: Indicates whether the public and project community have access to uncensored records of submitted grievances

name: grievanceDate
label: Date by which grievance mechanism was/will be open to communities
description: Date when the grievance mechanism first became (or will become) operational (e.g., project start date)

name: grievanceDetails
label: Overview of the grievance mechanism available for stakeholders
description: Description of the grievance mechanism, including how it works, who can access it, and the general measures for responding to grievances (e.g., monthly community listening sessions with follow-up, a monitored email inbox with a ticketing system, or other methods suited to the local context)

name: grievanceSupport
label: Grievance mechanism supporting documents
description: Uploads may include details on the grievance mechanism's structure, reported issues addressed, and availability date

name: benefitSharing
label: Project will implement a benefit sharing model
description: Benefit sharing with the local community (e.g. subsidization of products, revenue sharing etc.)

name: benefitSharingNoExplanation
label: Rationale for no benefit sharing
description: If relevant, explanation of how benefits related to the carbon credit project are established and assigned to different stakeholders

name: benefitSharingExplanation
label: Benefit sharing model explanation
description: If relevant, explanation of how benefits related to the carbon credit project are established and assigned to different stakeholders

name: benefitUpload
label: Benefit sharing agreement supporting documentation
description: Supporting evidence of the benefit sharing agreement

name: benefitSharingCommunities
label: Benefit sharing agreement in place with Indigenous communities
description: Indicates whether a benefit-sharing agreement exists specifically with Indigenous communities near the project area

name: benefitSharingType
label: Benefit sharing type offered to Indigenous, tribal, and/or local communtities
description: Indicates the type of benefit-sharing agreement established
options: In-kind benefits or public goods - Local infrastructure improvements
In-kind benefits or public goods - Local employment

name: iplcOwnershipPercent
label: Current or projected % of company owned by Indigenous, tribal, and local communities
description: Percentage of ownership held by Indigenous Peoples and Local Communities (IPLC) in the company or organization developing the project

name: benefitSharingPercent
label: Projected % sale price going to Indigenous, tribal, and local communities
description: Percentage of the carbon credit sale price projected to go directly to Indigenous, tribal, or local communities involved in the project

name: airMonitoringPlan
label: Project has or will implement an air pollution monitoring plan
description: Air pollution monitoring plans often include pollutants to be monitored, frequency of monitoring, and outlined data collection/mangement practices

name: airMonitoringPlanEvidence
label: Air pollution monitoring plan documentation
description: Evidence of the project plans to monitor air pollution

name: baselineComparisonPlan
label: Project plans to measure pollutants against baseline air quality
description: If the project conducts a baseline air quality study (before project start or using a control site), monitoring results will be compared against these baseline levels

name: airExpectedImpacts
label: Summary of expected air quality impacts of the project activity
description: Description of expected air quality impacts, such as improved indoor air quality for households using the project technology

name: airMonitoringDomains
label: Domains included in the air pollution monitoring plan
description: Project plans may focus on indoor air quality, ambient air quality, or both

name: airMonitoringDescription
label: Description of air pollution monitoring plan
description: Details of the air pollution monitoring plan the project intends to implement

name: airMonitoringBaseline
label: Pollutants monitored in baseline air quality
description: Air monitoring can include continuous measurement of criteria air pollutants or tracking of the air quality index in a target region, for example

name: airBaselineDescription
label: Description of baseline air quality
description: Information on baseline or control air quality in the project area before project activities (indoor, ambient, or both)

name: airBaselineEvidence
label: Baseline air quality documentation
description: Documents related to baseline air pollution, including air quality measurements or calculations. Baseline indoor air pollution data may come from field or lab tests, technology operation models, or expert opinions, while ambient pollution data may use regional datasets

name: baselineWaterEvidence
label: Baseline water resource supporting documents
description: Evidence or documentation of baseline water analysis

name: waterMonitoringFrequency
label: Monitoring frequency of water resources
description: Details on how frequently the project developer will monitor water resources affected by the project activity

name: waterMonitoringPlan
label: Project plans to monitor water resources
description: Water monitoring plans typically specify which pollutants and water levels or availability will be monitored, along with procedures for data collection and management

name: waterStewardship
label: Water-related activity classification within the project activity
description: Classification of water-related activities undertaken as part of the project activity (e.g., water demand reduction, water efficiency measures, land restoration, etc.)
options: Land conservation and restoration - Land conservation (protection and preservation)
Land conservation and restoration - Land cover restoration
Water supply reliability - Agricultural water demand reduction measures
Water supply reliability - Operational efficiency measures
Water supply reliability - Consumer use efficiency measures
Water supply reliability - New water supply for water irrigation
Water access - Access to drinking water supply
Water Quality - Agricultural best management practices
Water Quality - Constructed wetland treatment systems
Aquatic habitat restoration - Wetland restoration and creation
Aquatic habitat restoration - Legal transactions to keep water in-stream
Aquatic habitat restoration - In-stream barrier removal
Aquatic habitat restoration - Floodplain inundation/reestablish hydrologic connection
Water Governance - direct engagement in water governance and pulic water management
Catalytic activities - Activities that pave the way for longer-term water stewardship outcomes

name: waterImpact
label: Project activity takes place near a water basin
description: Project is located near an area where water (from rainfall, snowmelt, or groundwater) collects and flows into a body of water such as a river, lake, or ocean

name: waterMonitorIntention
label: Description of water resources monitoring plan
description: Details of the water monitoring plan the project intends to implement

name: expectedWaterImpacts
label: Expected water impacts as a result of the project activity
description: Type of water-related impact anticipated from project activities
options: Project affects local ground water recharge rates

name: waterLocalDetails
label: Summary of expected water impacts of the project activity
description: Description of any expected impacts on water quality or availability

name: waterBaselineCondition
label: Project evaluates initial water resources
description: Project conducts a baseline water survey

name: waterBaselineDescription
label: Description of baseline water resources
description: Summary of baseline water resources (i.e., baseline water survey results)

name: endangeredSpeciesConditional
label: Project may pose risks to threatened or endangered species
description: Identification of any expected negative impacts on threatened or endangered species

name: ecosystemBiome
label: Biome type
description: Type of biome in which the project operates

name: biodiversityMonitoringPlan
label: Biodiversity monitoring plan documentation
description: Documentation or supporting evidence of the biodiversity monitoring plan

name: ecosystemCategorization
label: Ecosystem categorization
description: As per the IUCN, ecosystem risk refers to an ecosystem's vulnerability of collapse, determined by reductions in geographical distribution or degradation of the components of ecosystems and the services they provide (more information can be found here: https://assessments.iucnrle.org/)

name: biomeDescription
label: Description of the biome
description: Biome type in the context of the IUCN Global Ecosystem Typology Version 2.0

name: biomeRiskCategory
label: Description of the biome risk category
description: Biome risk category in the context of the IUCN Global Ecosystem Typology Version 2.0

name: biodiversityMonitoring
label: Project plans to identify and monitor related biodiversity impacts before, during, and after project implementation
description: Project plans ongoing biodiversity monitoring of the broader environment or at least one identified variable (e.g., at-risk species)

name: baselineBiodiversity
label: Project has conducted an initial biodiversity survey
description: Biodiversity baseline survey conducted to monitor elements such as species abundance, habitat area, and related factors

name: biodiversityImpactDrivers
label: Summary of expected biodiversity impacts of the project activity
description: Description of expected biodiversity and other ecosystem impacts of the project and their drivers. Impacts can include both positive and negative impacts, as well as both inside and outside the project area.

name: threatenedSpecies
label: International Union for Conservation (IUCN) threatened and endangered species
description: Overview of the threatened and endangered species in the surrounding geographic region or otherwise potentially affected by project activities

name: biodiversityMonitoringProcess
label: Biodiversity monitoring plan
description: The process of identifying and monitoring relevant biodiversity indicators (e.g., fauna, flora, and non-timber forest products) before and after project intervention

name: biodiversityLegal
label: Legal framework governing the threatened and endangered species
description: The regulatory frameworks governing monitoring, protection, or project impacts on threatened or endangered species

name: baselineSoilSurvey
label: A baseline soil health survey been conducted
description: Indicates whether a baseline soil quality study (before project start or using a control site) has been conducted

name: soilType
label: Primary type of soil order type of project site
description: Each of the twelve soil orders represents a grouping of soils with distinct characteristics and ecological significance

name: baselineSoilSurveyUpload
label: Baseline soil health survey
description: Baseline soil health survey documentation (e.g., survey findings, template)

name: erosionDiligence
label: Area in which the project takes place is at high risk for erosion
description: High erosion risk, defined by the World Atlas of Desertification Global Erosion Map, with R factors of 20 or higher indicating ‘high erosion risk’

name: soilMonitoringPlanDetails
label: Overview of soil monitoring plan
description: Description of the soil monitoring plan, including testing types and frequency

name: soilMonitoringPlan
label: Plan in place for soil testing and monitoring
description: Indicates if the project will follow a protocol to sample, measure, and analyze soil health and changes caused by project activities

name: soilEffects
label: Summary of expected soil impacts of the project activity
description: Description of expected soil impacts (e.g., physical, chemical, and biological soil ecosystem impacts). If relevant and known, the assessment should reference soil temperature, type, and chemistry)

name: baseline
label: Baseline scenario overview
description: A description of the expected scenario if the project were not implemented, such as the likely alternative use or disposal of biomass feedstock in biomass-based projects, along with the underlying assumptions used to estimate baseline emissions

name: baselineSupporting
label: Baseline scenario supporting documents

name: fixedBaselinePeriod
label: Current fixed baseline period or historical look-back period
description: If applicable. Some standards or methodologies require that the baseline scenrio is based on a fixed ("static") historical lookback period or schedule of previous land management activities.

name: dynamicBaseline
label: The project implements dynamic baselining
description: Baselines are traditionally established by predicting what would have happened in the absence of the project. Dynamic baselines can take different formats, but are usually estbalished by observing a reference area as it changes over time.

name: dynamicBaselineSummary
label: Overview of dynamic baselining approach
description: Overview of the project's dynamic baselining approach

name: conservativeMeasures
label: Summary of initiatives undertaken to ensure the project's integrity and scientific robustness
description: Overview of measures taken to ensure that the GHG emission reductions or removals from the mitigation activity are be robustly quantified, based on conservative approaches, completeness, and scientific methods

name: scalability
label: Project scalability
description: Overview of the project's plans and/or ability to increase in scale

name: netNegativityPartial
label: Project has a net carbon negative impact
description: Indication of whether the project will result in more GHG emissions removed from the atmosphere than would be emitted

name: netNegativityPartialExplain
label: Net carbon negativity overview
description: Description of how the project activity results in net carbon negativity

name: deviations
label: Methodology deviations
description: Includes information such as whether the deviation meets the criteria for permitted methodology deviations, whether the deviation negatively impacts the conservativeness of the quantification of emission reductions or removals (except where they result in increased accuracy), or any previously validated methodology deviations

name: sensitiveInformation
label: Commercially sensitive information
description: Explanation of why some proprietary information has been redacted or not included

name: generalDocumentUploac
label: General document upload
description: A general document upload field, in which any documents that are not explicitly asked for can be uploaded

name: technologyManufacturer
label: Technology manufacturer or provider
description: If relevant, the providers or manufacturers of any technology or equipment used substantially in the project activity

name: technicalUpload
label: Project technology and technical process supporting documents
description: Documentation regarding the project technology (e.g., manufacturer specifications, field reports, standard certifications) or technical processes (e.g., process flow diagrams)

name: projectBoundaries
label: Total area within project boundaries

name: stratificationStrategy
label: Strategy for stratification of project area
description: Strata may be defined based on soil type and depth, water table depth, vegetation, salinity, land type or expected changes in these characteristics.

name: spatialInformation
label: Spatial information on stratified project area
description: Stratification helps improve the accuracy of carbon stock and GHG flux estimates, based on specifics of the project's land use characteristics. Individual strata areas must be spatially discrete, identifiable with accurate spatial data, and sum to the total project area. Land use/land cover maps must be ground-truthed, less than 10 years old, or proven to be accurate.

name: emissionSourcesTable
label: Emission sources included in the project boundary

name: lcaPartial
label: LCA is used to quantify emissions

name: lcaTable
label: LCA repository

name: lca
label: LCA has been completed

name: lcaUpload
label: LCA upload

name: systemBoundaryDetails
label: System boundary overview and justification
description: The system boundary of the project's life cycle assessment

name: systemBoundaryFigure
label: System boundary figure
description: Relevant figures depicting the process flows and system boundaries

name: lcaPuroResultsTable
label: LCA results
description: The results from the most recent life cycle assessment

columns.name: llcaPuroResultsTableStartDate
columns.label: Reporting period start
columns.description: Indicates the most recent reporting period start date

columns.name: lcaPuroResultsTableEndDate
columns.label: Reporting period end
columns.description: Indicates the most recent reporting period end date

columns.name: lcaPuroResultsTableFirstLevel
columns.label: Level 1
columns.description: Level 1 contributions refer to high-level groups of emissions. In the example of biochar, the level 1 categories would entail Estored (the overall carbon sequestered from the atmopshere by the biomass), Ebiomass (emissions related to biomass sourcing), Eproduction (emissions related to biochar production), and Euse (emissions related to the biochar use).

columns.name: lcaPuroResultsTableSecondLevel
columns.label: Level 2
columns.description: The level 2 contributions provide more details than level 1. It is a break down of the main sources of emissions arising in each level 1 category.

columns.name: lcaPuroResultsTableThirdLevel
columns.label: Level 3
columns.description: If desired, the level 2 categories can be further detailed in level 3

columns.name: lcaPuroResultsTableFu
columns.label: Climate impact in kg CO2-eq per functional unit

columns.name: lcaPuroResultsTableRp
columns.label: Climate impact in kg CO2-eq per reporting period

name: forecastConditional
label: Project forecasts emission reductions and/or removals
description: Forecasting carbon removals or reductions is the process of estimating the amount of greenhouse gases that a project is expected to remove from or prevent from entering the atmosphere over a future period, based on scientific models, historical data, and project-specific assumptions

name: totalForecast
label: Credit period forecast
description: The total estimated issued credits over the crediting period (i.e., tonnes of CO2e removed, avoided, or reduced)

name: partialForecast
label: Credit forecast by vintage
description: The estimated credits per vintage year throughout the crediting period

name: forecastAssumptions
label: Credit forecasting mechanism and assumptions
description: Credit forecasting mechanism and assumptions refers to the approach, models, and key assumptions used to estimate future carbon credit generation

name: forecastComments
label: Additional comments on forecast
description: Optional additional context on the credit forecast

name: forecastWorkbook
label: Forecast supporting documents
description: Documentation may include registry-specific forecast templates (such as the ACR ERT calculator) and other templates or documents that support the calculations

name: parametersFixedTable
label: Ex-ante fixed parameters
description: Fixed (ex-ante) parameters are values set at the start of the project and typically  remain constant throughout a crediting period. They are usually based on established scientific research, default factors, or regulatory guidance.

columns.name: parametersFixedTablePurpose
columns.label: Purpose
columns.description: Concise overview of the parameter's relevance (e.g., to calculate baseline emissions)

name: parametersMonitoredTable
label: Monitored parameters overview
description: Monitored parameters are measured or observed during the project’s implementation and reporting periods. They reflect actual project performance and environmental conditions.

columns.name: parametersMonitoredTablePurpose
columns.label: Purpose
columns.description: Concise overview of the parameter's relevance (e.g., to calculate baseline emissions)

name: dataParameters
label: Additional comments on fixed and monitored parameters
description: Optional additional context regarding the fixed and monitored parameters used in project calculations

name: monitoringPlan
label: MRV protocol and monitoring plan overview
description: The monitoring plan may include: technical description of the monitoring tasks, data to be collected, overview of data collection procedures, quality control and quality assurance procedures, data archiving and organization and responsibilities of the parties involved

name: monitoringTimeline
label: Monitoring timeline
description: Overview of the monitoring timeline embedded within the project's monitoring plan

name: monitoringTeam
label: Roles, responsibilities, and capacity of monitoring team and management

name: dataProcess
label: Data processing and storage procedures
description: Overview of the methods used to collect, clean, and securely store project monitoring data to ensure accuracy, traceability, and long-term accessibility

name: monitoringWorkbook
label: Monitoring supporting documents
description: Documents underpinning the monitoring approach (e.g., details on the parameters monitored, monitoring plan documentation etc.)

name: permanenceNumber
label: Permanence
description: The projected duration (in years) over which removed carbon will be stored or prevented from entering the atmosphere, accounting for risks of reversal over time

name: removalProcess
label: Carbon removal process
description: Carbon removal process refers to the specific mechanism by which a carbon dioxide removal (CDR) method sequesters CO₂ from the atmosphere, categorized according to the IPCC AR6 framework based on its role in the carbon cycle (e.g., biological, geochemical, ocean-based, or chemical pathways)

name: removalProcessOther
label: Other carbon removal process

name: storageType
label: Storage type
description: Carbon storage type refers to the form and location in which removed carbon is stored, categorized by the IPCC as terrestrial/biological (e.g., biomass, soil), geological (e.g., rock formations), marine/oceanic, or product-based (e.g., durable materials), each with varying levels of stability and permanence

name: storageTypeOther
label: Other storage type

name: carbonStorageDetails
label: Carbon storage overview
description: Details on how the carbon is stored and the estimated duration for which it remains stored in a safe and stable manner

name: unavoidableRiskTable
label: Assessment of unavoidable risks

name: avoidableRiskTable
label: Assessment of avoidable risks
description: Avoidable or intentional risks for carbon projects are risks that can be reasonably mitigated through proper project design, implementation, and management (e.g., financial viability, operational or technical risks related to project management, project design and execution, project governance, contractual breaches, disputes, etc.)

name: reversalRiskOther
label: Project risk assessment
description: Optional additional context on the assessment of potential project risks (i.e., risks to carbon durability, risks to project viability, and/or risks to credit delivery)

name: riskSummaryUpload
label: Risk assessment documentation
description: Any documentation supporting the risk assessment

name: opportunityCostAnalysisRmifw
label: Opportunity cost analysis
description: Opportunity cost analysis shall be based on the net present value (NPV) of the alternative land uses identified in the project's additionality assessment, except where most baseline activities are subsistence driven. Where most baseline activities are subsistence driven, an NPV analysis is not required.

name: financialViabilityRmifw
label: Financial viability
description: Financial viability includes two main components: 1. The number of years until breakeven is reached (i.e.,the payback period). 2. The funding secured relative to what is needed to implement and operate the project until reaching breakeven.

name: durStakeholderAnalysisRmifw
label: Durability stakeholder analysis
description: All stakeholders includes all indigenous peoples and local communities with statutory or customary rights to land or resources in the project area(s) as well as description of past/ongoing disputes over land or resources in the project area(s) and their resolution or future resolution.

name: politicalRiskRmifw
label: Political risk
description: Mean should be averaged over the most recent five years of available data

name: riskManagementPlan
label: Risk management plan in place
description: A risk management plan encompasses a strategy for managing and mitigating risks that could impact a carbon project's ability to generate valid credits

name: riskPlan
label: Risk management plan
description: Overview of the project's plan to mitigate risk (i.e., a systematic overview of the measures taken to mitigate and/or monitor reversal and project risks)

name: riskManagementPlanUpload
label: Risk management plan supporting documents

name: reversalRiskMitigationStrategy
label: Reversal risk mitigation strategy
description: The strategy to address the potential loss of sequestered carbon by using financial tools or reserves, such as insurance or buffer pools, to compensate for potential reversals and ensure long-term credit validity

name: otherReversalRiskMitigationStrategy
label: Other reversal risk mitigation strategy type

name: insuranceOwner
label: Insurance policy issuer and owner

name: insuranceEvidence
label: Insurance supporting evidence

name: adaptiveCapacityEvaluationSeceltionRmifw
label: Adaptive capacity evaluation selection
description: Adaptive capacity can be described as considerations a project proponent has taken into account when developing a project that mitigates future risk of climate change. Please refer to the Verra AFOLU Non Permanence Risk Tool for further details on the options provided.

name: durStakeholderConsultationRmifw
label: Durability stakeholder consultation

name: adaptiveCapacityEvaluationSupportinEvidenceRmifw
label: Adaptive capacity evaluation supporting evidence

name: additionalityApproachUsed
label: Additionality approaches used in the project
description: Evaluating additionality ensures that carbon credits are granted only to mitigation activities that would not have occurred without the incentives provided by the carbon credit

name: noAdditionalityValidationDetails
label: Justification for the absence of additionality validation

name: validationAdditionality
label: The selected additionality approaches have been validated
description: All elements of the chosen additionality approaches have been assessed by a validation or verification body and/or a carbon-crediting program or standard

name: validationAdditionalityThirdParty
label: Additionality validation body

name: recentUpdate
label: Latest review
description: The most recent year that the assessment for the standardized approach was reviewed

name: firstOfItsKind
label: Project mitigation activity is the first-of-its-kind
description: First-of-its-kind projects implement innovative approaches or technologies that set them apart from any existing practices or solutions within a given sector or region

name: firstOfItsKindAnalysis
label: First-of-its-kind mitigation activity details and justification

name: firstOfItsKindUpload
label: Supporting documentation for first-of-its-kind projects

name: regulatorySurplus
label: The project is not required by and/or exceeds existing applicable laws, regulations, or other binding obligations
description: Regulatory additionality ensures that a carbon credit can only be issued for a mitigation activity that goes beyond what is required by existing laws or regulations

name: regulatorySurplusTestDetails
label: Relevant laws, regulations, and/or binding obligations justifying the regulatory surplus test
description: Overview of applicable laws and regulations used to justify regulatory additionality by demonstrating that the mitigation activity is not legally required

name: regulatorySurplusUpload
label: Supporting documentation demonstrating legal and regulatory additionality

name: commonPractice
label: The project demonstrates a low level of penetration or successfully passes the common practice test within a similar sector, region, or activity
description: The common practice or market penetration test evaluates whether a mitigation activity is widely adopted in a sector or region. If the activity is already standard practice, it is not considered additional and is therefore ineligible for carbon credits.

name: threshold
label: Threshold or maximum adoption level for market penetration

name: commonPracticeDetails
label: Common practice test details
description: Overview of the approach used to determine additionality and the methodology, carbon-crediting program, or equivalent entity responsible for determining the threshold for market penetration

name: commonPracticeUpload
label: Common practice additionality supporting documentation

name: initialAdditionality
label: Project is a direct result of carbon credit finance
description: Project is not financially feasible or is less financially attractive without carbon credit revenues compared to the alternatives of the mitigation activity

name: additionalityDemonstration
label: Demonstration that the project activities are a result of carbon finance

name: investmentMethod
label: Investment analysis approach
description: Indicates which assessment method is used for the financial investment analysis

name: simpleCostAdditionality
label: Project has no other income or minimal capital expenditures compared to operational expenditures

name: simpleCostAnalysis
label: Simple cost analysis details
description: Simple cost analysis is a financial additionality test that compares a project's expected costs and revenues to determine if it would be economically unattractive without carbon credit income. If the project does not generate sufficient returns or would operate at a loss without the added revenue from credits, it may be deemed additional.

name: simpleCostUpload
label: Simple cost analysis documentation

name: financialIndicator
label: Chosen financial indicator
description: The suitable financial indicator, such as the net present value (NPV) or internal rate of return (IRR) used consistently throughout calculations

name: financialIndicatorOther
label: If "Other", explanation

name: benchmarkUsed
label: Project uses a financial benchmark approach
description: The benchmark approach compares a project's expected return (e.g., IRR or NPV) to a predefined financial benchmark. If the project's return falls below this benchmark without carbon credit revenue, it may be considered financially additional.

name: benchmarkJustification
label: Justification and results of the financial benchmark analysis

name: benchmarkUpload
label: Financial benchmark calculations and documentation

name: investmentComparisonDetails
label: Justification and results of the investment comparison analysis
description: The investment comparison approach assesses whether the proposed project is less economically attractive than one or more alternative investment options. If the project would not be chosen over more financially viable alternatives without carbon credit revenue, it may be considered additional.

name: investmentComparisonUpload
label: Investment comparison calculations and documentation

name: sensitivityAnalysis
label: Project conducts a sensitivity analysis
description: A sensitivity analysis is required to show whether the conclusion regarding the financial attractiveness is robust to reasonable variation in the critical assumptions

name: sensitivityAnalysisDetails
label: Results of sensitivity analysis

name: sensitivityUpload
label: Sensitivity analysis documentation

name: projectRevenues

name: costs
label: Breakdown of project costs
description: Detailed breakdown of all project-related costs, including both operational expenditures and capital expenditures

name: barrier
label: The project faces an implementation barrier for which carbon credit revenues are the decisive element in overcoming the barrier
description: Barrier analysis is an additionality test used to identify and assess the key obstacles (e.g., financial, technical, regulatory, or market-related) that would prevent a project from being implemented without carbon credit revenue

name: barrierType
label: Implementation barrier(s) the project faces
description: Indicates which type of barrier analysis is conducted. Examples of each include: financial barriers, institutional barriers, information barriers, other barriers specific to the project and/or region where the project is implemented if these barriers are explicitly identified and elaborated in the relevant quantification methodology or other program documents.

name: barrierTypeOther
label: Other barrier type(s)

name: fiancialBarrierDetails
label: Explanation and results of chosen barrier(s)

name: barrierDemo
label: Demonstration of barriers
description: Evidence to (i) demonstrate each identified barrier and (ii) show that carbon credit revenues are the key factor in overcoming each barrier

name: barrierAlternative
label: Alternative scenario barrier details
description: Demonstration that at least one other alternative to the project does not face significant barriers, including the barriers faced by the project

name: barrierAlternativeUpload
label: Supporting documentation for alternative scenario barrier(s)

name: performanceAdditionality

description: Performance-based additionality is an approach where a project’s carbon credit eligibility is tied to its actual performance in achieving emission reductions or removals

name: performanceAdditionalityDetails
label: Details and results of performance-based additionality approach

name: performanceAdditionalityUpload
label: Evidence and documentation of performance-based additionality

name: counterfactualEvidence

name: priorConsiderationOfCredits

name: creditSalesStage
label: Credit sales type
description:
Spot: A sale where carbon credits are exchanged and delivered immediately at the current market price.
Offtake Agreement: A long-term contract where a buyer agrees to purchase a specific volume of carbon credits over time, often before they are issued.
Forward: A contract where carbon credits are sold at an agreed-upon price for delivery at a future date.
Other: Any other type of carbon credit sale that doesn’t fit the standard definitions, such as custom agreements or hybrid structures.

name: genderHarassmentMeasures

description: Actions the project has taken to safeguard against gender-based inequality, such as ensuring wage equity or improving women’s access to markets

name: genderConsultation

name: genderSuccess
label: Women are central to the project's success
description: Project success is achieved when it meets or exceeds the W+ Standards requirements for one or more of six success indicators, which span these domains: Income and Assets; Time; Education and Knowledge; Leadership; Food Security; and Health. To demonstrate success, a project must clearly define the activities that have improved women’s lives and provide meaningful, quantifiable evidence of these positive outcomes.

name: womenConsultation
label: Project consults women separately on their perspectives and concerns
description: Consultation may include one-on-one interviews, women-only focus groups, and/or additional field survey methods that enable separate consultation with women

name: indigenousContractUpdates

These activities can be due to involuntary acquisition / restrictions on land use or limiting access to legally designated parks and protected areas.
